title: Question about a censored word
body: I saw a post on the player behavior boards with the phrase "a%%%%m" (it came censored and the OP tried to comment what the word was after seeing it censored in their post and it got censored again so I'm assuming it was a mod or auto censored).  I could be wrong, but I think this is related to the developmental disorder in which case I don't understand why it would be censored?  Some people wrongly use it as an insult but treating the term for that disorder as a slur and censoring it because of that seems wrong.  I'm mostly concerned because I have that disorder so I'm hoping I'm mistaken about what that word is.

replies.body: I suspect that user is self-censoring. It doesn't look like it's on the filter list, but I'd have to see the specific post to be sure.

Oh that's weird.  I wonder what would possess them to self censor twice like that?  Thank you for checking!
It is more or less exclusively used as an insult online, that is all the answer that is needed.

So I could get penalized for talking about a disorder I have just because other people use my disorder as an insult?  That still seems pretty messed up.  My friend group and I all have it and frequently talk about it and how it affects us.  Why validate the idea that our disorder is an insult by censoring it (especially since the *actual* slurs tied to it aren't censored)?

You dont have any reason to talk about it in-game.

It just sounds like you are looking for loopholes in the system..

Why would I use my own disorder as an insult that doesn’t even make sense... I don’t even call other people autistic.  The closest I get to calling people that is me telling a friend “oh that’s the autism” because they ask why they do something (hint: it’s because we both have the disorder and they’re describing a common experience we share).  I was literally just asking because I don’t want to be penalized if I talk about my own disorder with my friends.  Because we use the chat function since we can’t always use voice chats.

Other people dont have the needed context, it is no different than a couple people jokingly using the n-word to refer to eachother. Unless you are among people you know that understand context and intent, just dont.

Did you really just compare “autism” to a racial slur????????  Those two are never comparable because autism isn’t a slur????????

 I only talk about my disorder when I’m among friends and not around randoms because I know a lot of players don’t like people like me so that isn’t even an issue.

Yes, i did. 

What you think about it does not dictate how society views it. It is extremely offensive to a lot of people, including some with autism spectrum disorders. I am surprised you are unaware of that, and it reinforces the fact you should be careful of your behavior in public, where people do not have context for it.

My disorder is not offensive.  Autism is the accepted medical term of my disorder and, as somebody who actively participates in my community, it is a term we hold dear and one we are constantly trying to normalize (normalize both our disorder and this term over the use of more offensive ones).   There are actual slurs for autism.  There are actual old medical terms that many of us consider to be offensive because of their origins but autism is not one of those terms.  Comparing the very name we ourselves choose to use and find acceptable to a slur, especially when there are actual slurs tied to autism, is not only disingenuous but harmful because it minimizes the damage of actual slurs such as the one you referenced.

At this point i am convinced you are just a troll.

But it still stands: you are wrong, society is right. Your personal opinion will not override what everyone else agrees on, and if you ignore the rules of society, society will punish that.

You think an autistic person is a troll for telling you that autism isn’t offensive.   Alright lol 

and you don’t need to remind me non autistic people hate autistic people.  I already knew that it’s why allistic people think being autistic is an insult.

..And you completely missed the point.

Dont be so insecure and defensive about it, and you wont see everyone 'hating'.

You told me the community accepted term for my disorder (autism) is the equivalent to a slur and should be censored because non autistic people think it's insulting to be called autistic.  That's literally you calling autism offensive.
